definition: to allow/to grant/in accordance with/in the light of

pinyin: Ge2 lin2 wei1 zhi4 Biao1 zhun3 shi2 jian1
Ge2 lin2 ni2 zhi4 Biao1 zhun3 shi2 jian1

sentences.english: Be on time to meetings-early if you can.
sentences.chinese: 开会记得准时，能早点到更好。

sentences.english: The train arrived on the dot of three o'clock.
sentences.chinese: 那辆火车三点钟准时到达。

sentences.english: The tenant failed to pay his rent punctually.
sentences.chinese: 这位房客未能准时交租。

sentences.english: The fish was biting so fast it was impossible to react on time.
sentences.chinese: 鱼游的如此快不可能准时反应过来。

sentences.english: We have some doubt whether they can complete the task ontime.
sentences.chinese: 我们怀疑他们是否能准时完成任务。

sentences.english: Putting food into an empty stomach helps synchronize the body clock.
sentences.chinese: 空腹吃食物帮助人体时钟准时。

sentences.english: The London to Edinburgh express steamed into Newcastle fight on time.
sentences.chinese: 从伦敦到爱丁堡的快车准时驶抵纽卡斯尔。

sentences.english: It was absolute hell trying to get this report finished on time.
sentences.chinese: 要准时完成这份报告可真是苦差使。

sentences.english: I knew what it looked like. In time I'd make my way back into the shuttle; I'd hit the thrusters on my spaceship and return to that good soil.
sentences.chinese: 我会准时回我的宇宙飞船，打开推进器返回那片土地。

sentences.english: A well-run organisation will also, in all likelihood, give a good account on the punctuality front.
sentences.chinese: 运营良好的组织将同时很可能提供良好的准时记录。

sentences.english: She attended every twice-weekly session of the group.
sentences.chinese: 她准时参加写作组每周两次的会议，从不缺席。

sentences.english: Is the five-thirty flight from Denver on time?
Is there any doubt that he'll attend the meeting on time?
sentences.chinese: 他准时出席会议有什么疑问吗？

sentences.english: We won't make it in time.
I think it impossible for us finish our work on time .
sentences.chinese: 我认为我们不可能准时完在这项工作。

sentences.english: Concern is not expressed for a meeting starting late or ending at a different time.
sentences.chinese: 即使会议延迟或者没有准时结束，也会不置一词。

definition: at dawn/at first light/first thing in the morning
lit. Even if we don't see each other, don't give up and leave (idiom)/fig. Be sure to wait!/See you there!
to fix a time/fixed time/timed (of explosive etc)
to get out of bed/to get up
in the evening/when night falls/towards evening/at night fall/at dusk
